Sure, here are a few examples of small riffs or motifs that can be transposed and used in different musical contexts using only the notes provided (F3, Bb3, C4, Eb4, F4, G4, Ab4, Bb4, C5) without using D and A:

1. A simple riff that uses the notes of the F Major chord (F, A, C) : F3, F4, C4, C5, F4, C4, C5, F4
2. A motif that uses the notes of the Ab Major chord (Ab, C, Eb) : Ab4, Ab4, C5, Eb5, Ab4, C5, Eb5, Ab4
3. A riff that uses the notes of the Bb Major chord (Bb, D, F) : Bb3, Bb4, F4, Bb4, F4, Bb4, F4, Bb4
4. A motif that uses the notes of the F minor chord (F, Ab, C) : F3, Ab4, C5, F4, C5, Ab4, C5, F4
5. A riff that uses the notes of the Eb Major chord (Eb, G, Bb) : Eb4, G4, Bb4, Eb5, G4, Bb4, G4, Eb5
6. A motif that uses the notes of the C Major chord (C, E, G) : C4, C5, G4, C5, G4, C5, G4, C5
